questions.prompt: How does role-based access control (RBAC) assign permissions?
questions.explanation: RBAC groups permissions under roles so that granting or removing a role updates a user’s effective access.

options.label: Permissions are tied to roles, and users inherit them by joining a role.
Permissions are granted directly to every individual user account.
Permissions are embedded in each hardware device.
Permissions are randomly rotated among logged-in users.

questions.prompt: Which XML snippet correctly represents <t> Alan and Mairi. dreamed. using the <t> tag?
questions.explanation: The <t> tag must wrap the entire expression and include the dreamed verb, making the second snippet the valid representation.
